Column Comment.0: RESERVES ENTITY IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for a reserves entity. A reservesentity may be comprised of a single business object (such as a well) or a group ofbusiness objects (such as all the completions producing from a pool).
Column Comment.1: RESERVE CLASS IDENTIFIER: The reserve classed for identifying the confidencelevel and producing status of the reserve volumes.
Column Comment.2: RESERVES ENTITY ECONOMICS RUN IDENTIFIER: a unique identifer for aneconomics run
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: CURRENCY CONVERSION: A number which, when multipled by the stored value,will re-create the original value in the original currency used.
Column Comment.5: CURRENCY ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The units of measure in which thecurrency was originally received.
Column Comment.6: PREFERRED CURRENCY: Indicates for the business associate, the type ofcurrency preferred for this type of transaction. Note that different preferences can beset for various types of transactions.
Column Comment.7: ECONOMIC FORECAST LIFE: Years remaining in the economic reserve forecast.
Column Comment.8: ECONOMIC SCENARIO: A set of assumptions regarding future pricing, operatingcosts, inflation factors etc. which are used to run economic evaluations.
Column Comment.9: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.10: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.11: GROSS SUMMARY INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of datarelates to gross values, as opposed to net values.
Column Comment.12: INTEREST SET IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the interest set.
Column Comment.13: BA INTEREST SET SEQUENCE NUMBER: unique sequencing component to allowverioning of the interest set over time.
Column Comment.14: NET SUMMARY INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data relatesto net values, as opposed to gross values.
Column Comment.15: NET PRESENT VALUE: This reflects the discounting of all future cash received,discounted at the DISCOUNT_RATE.
Column Comment.16: PARTNER BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a businessassociate, such as a person, company, regulatory agency, government orconsortium. Unique identifier for the business associate who is a partner in aninterest set.
Column Comment.17: PARTNER OBSERVATION NUMBER: This column is used when a businessassociate holds more than one interest share of a specific interest type (working,production etc) in a partnership. This can happen as a result of corporate mergers orasset acquisitions. If a partner only holds one interest share, this number will alwaysbe 1. Please note that this column should not be used to track multiple interest types;in this event, a new interest set must be created.
Column Comment.18: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.19: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.20: RESERVE LIFE INDEX: Remaining reserves volume divided by previous yearsproduction volume. Measured in years.
Column Comment.21: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.22: TECHNICAL FORECAST LIFE: Years remaining in the technical reserve forecast.
Column Comment.23: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.24: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.25: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.26: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.27: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.28: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.29: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
